PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Characterization of the oligogalacturonides receptor WAK1 in the defense processes
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Conserved pathogen/microbe-associated molecular patterns and endogenous molecular patterns, which are present only when the tissue is infected or damaged (damage-associated molecular patterns), act as danger signals to activate the plant immune response. These molecules are recognized by surface receptors that are referred to as pattern recognition receptors. Oligogalacturonides (OGs) are damage-associated molecular patterns released from the plant cell wall and are thought to be signals in the response to wounding. It has been demonstrated that the Arabidopsis Wall-Associated Kinase 1 (WAK1) is a receptor of OGs. Using Arabidopsis plants overexpressing WAK1 this project aims to investigate the role of WAK1 in the perception of the OGs and in the wound response.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Characterization of the oligogalacturonides receptor WAK1 in the defense processes

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Universitа degli Studi di Roma La Sapienza

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dipartimento di Biologia e Biotecnologie C. Darwin

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Development of chimeric receptor to improve plants resistance
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Plant diseases cause a dramatic reduction in agriculture yield representing an economic and environmental issue. Many of the chemical compounds used to reduce plant disease are toxic for plants and humans and their intensive use determines the emergence of new resistant strains of pathogens. Therefore it is important to develop more sustainable systems for the diseases control of cultivated species. Enhance the plant immune system could be a strategy to improve the resistance reducing the agrochemical applications and their economic, environmental and health risks. Plants depend for their survival by an efficient immune system that relies on the recognition of pathogens by surface receptors (PRRs, Pattern Recognition Receptor) or cytoplamic receptors (R proteins). Several studies showed that the overexpression in plants of PRRs or R proteins can be used to engineer resistance to a broad spectrum of pathogens. Moreover it has been demonstrated that the expression of chimeric receptor based on PRRs with known function confers resistance to different phytopathogens. The aim of this project is to develop an approach to engineering the plant resistance by the generation and overexpression in N. tabacum of chimeric receptors based on PRRs and R Protein.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Universitа degli Studi di Roma La Sapienza

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Identificaзгo de Fatores de Transcriзгo que Regulam Genes da Biossнntese de Vitamina E em Solanum lycopersicum
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Pelo seu alto consumo e composiзгo bioquнmica, o fruto tomate й uma importante fonte de compostos com atividade antioxidante, como carotenoides, бcido ascуrbico (vitamina C) e tocoferуis (vitamina E) na dieta humana. O nosso grupo de pesquisa й pioneiro no estudo do metabolismo de tocoferуis em tomateiro. Alйm da sua importвncia nutricional, os tocoferуis sгo constituintes fundamentais da maquinaria fotossintйtica sintetizados nos plastнdios. Embora os conteъdos de tocoferol nгo variem muito durante o desenvolvimento e amadurecimento dos frutos, nos diferentes estбdios, o precursor fitil-2P pode alternativamente provir da rota do metil-eritritol-fosfato ou da reciclagem do fitol provindo da degradaзгo de clorofila. Ainda se desconhecem fatores de transcriзгo que regulam a expressгo de genes da rota biossintйtica de tocoferуis nos frutos, porйm dados do nosso grupo indicam que a luz estб envolvida. Й justamente esse ponto que serб explorado no presente projeto. Aplicando tйcnicas de interaзгo proteнna-DNA, serб estudado o papel de fatores de transcriзгo envolvidos na sinalizaзгo luminosa na regulaзгo da biossнntese de tocoferol.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundaзгo de Amparo а Pesquisa do Estado de Sгo Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Unravelling key protein-protein interactions involved in plastidial development and function in Solanum lycopersicum
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Plastids development and metabolism are very important processes for yield and nutritional quality in crop plants, such as Solanum lycopersicum. The production of primary metabolites and the nutrient accumulation in fruit are indeed closely related to the maintenance of photosynthetically active chloroplasts. The plastid biogenesis and maintenance are regulated by light and hormone signaling and mediated by transcription factors. The interaction between phytochromes and PHYTOCHROME INTERACTING FACTORS (PIFs) has a fundamental role in these processes regulating the expression of genes involved in the response to light. Additionally, G2-LIKE TRANSCRIPTION FACTORS, GLK1 and GLK2, also play an important role in the maintenance of chloroplasts in Arabidopsis thaliana. In particular, the interaction of these elements with ORE1, a transcription factor involved in leaf senescence, inhibits their activity resulting in a negative regulation of the chloroplast maintenance. So far, studies on these key protein-protein interactions involved in plastidial development were performed only in A. thaliana, whereas functional specificity of these proteins and their interactions have not been described in any crop species of economic and nutritional interest. This project aims to unraveling these interactions increasing our knowledge about the mechanisms of plastid development and function and enabling the development of new strategies to improve productivity and nutritional quality in tomato plants.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Plastids development and metabolism are very important processes for yield and nutritional quality in crop plants, such as Solanum lycopersicum. The production of primary metabolites and the nutrient accumulation in fruit are indeed closely related to the maintenance of photosynthetically active chloroplasts. The plastid biogenesis and maintenance are regulated by light and hormone signaling and mediated by transcription factors. The interaction between phytochromes and PHYTOCHROME INTERACTING FACTORS (PIFs) has a fundamental role in these processes regulating the expression of genes involved in the response to light. Additionally, G2-LIKE TRANSCRIPTION FACTORS, GLK1 and GLK2, also play an important role in the maintenance of chloroplasts in Arabidopsis thaliana. In particular, the interaction of these elements with ORE1, a transcription factor involved in leaf senescence, inhibits their activity resulting in a negative regulation of the chloroplast maintenance. So far, studies on these key protein-protein interactions involved in plastidial development were performed only in A. thaliana, whereas functional specificity of these proteins and their interactions have not been described in any crop species of economic and nutritional interest. This project aims to unraveling these interactions increasing our knowledge about the mechanisms of plastid development and function and enabling the development of new strategies to improve productivity and nutritional quality in tomato plants.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Unravelling key protein-protein interactions involved in plastidial development and function in Solanum lycopersicum
